text:
How can I log the access.log and even better the error.log, too, into the
UserDir? My users want to have them but giving them access to the global one
would raise privacy concerns. Is the only way to type a houndred times
"CustomLog /home/xyz/access.log full"?
creator: ch@lathspell.de
psychosos@gmx.at
text:
The logging module is kept as simple as possible. You should split the "main" log file into the 
"user" log files by a 3rd party program/script. (either every week/day/etc or use the Customlog 
"|yoursplitscript" format.
Therefor I think the Apache developers won't realize your 
wishes.. (just an uneducated guess though;)

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Actually, I can tell you why your wish cannot be effectively granted.
  Access and error logs are created at server startup.  If we did so, the
  number of FDs in use would grow to an absurd number.  As Psychopath points
  out, either distributing the logs after the fact, or dynamically using
  piped logs and a custom script is the only sensible solution.
